item.title: Phone call to the FBI Victim Services
item.description: On February 15, 2023, I tried to call a phone number I found on an FBI brochure related to the FBI Victim Services. The phone number was (202)-324-3000. But the FBI operator hanged up on me. After the FBI informed me the FBI was recording the phone call, I informed the operator that I was also recording the phone call and he disagreed so he hanged up.

item.title: Reply from French Law Professor Yves Strickler
item.description: Note: this email has been redacted for brevity. Check the French version of this page for the full content. Key point: French law professor Yves Strickler didn’t disapprove the possibility for me to do a hunger strike to protest the repeated violations of my fundamental rights by France. For the record, I am now accusing McDonald’s of having corrupted French officials. It might help to explain why McDonald’s France and McDonald’s Corporation, and their accomplices, have never been indicted for serious fraud and money laundering in France.

item.title: “I sold my soul to McDonald’s”
item.description: This book contains a crucial evidence that McDonald’s Corporation executives could have easily, through a simple phone call, stop the ongoing frauds which were happening in France. Then, why didn’t they? In addition to the fact that there is an undeniable proof that, contrarily to what Gloria Santona said, this was a French problem, the book offers additional insights about how McDonald’s seems to corrupt politicians.
